{"step_by_step_thinking": "Placenta grade 3 indicates that the placenta is mature and aging. Absent end diastolic flow Doppler suggests that there is compromised blood flow to the fetus. At 35+3 weeks of pregnancy, the fetus is considered near term. The management in this case would depend on the overall well-being of the fetus. Termination of the pregnancy may be considered if there is evidence of fetal compromise. However, before making any decisions, it is important to consult with a pediatrician to assess the potential risks and benefits. Monitoring the fetus closely with regular ultrasounds and non-stress tests may also be an option to assess the fetal well-being.", "answer_choice": "D. Monitor"}
